Welcome to Chessao’s documentation!¶

Indices and tables¶

  • Index
  • Module Index
  • Search Page
chessao.helpers.deal(deck, override=None, number=5)¶

Deal for #number cads to each player.

Returns a tuple with two lists and Deck object. Override parameter specifies the hands for players.

chessao.helpers.invert_color(color)¶

Return the other color.

chessao.helpers.ktora_kupka(karta, kupki, rnd=False)¶

Return the index of a pile wherein the card goes. Expects a list with a card, and a list of two Deck objects.

chessao.helpers.last_line_check(color, first_sq, last_sq, board)¶

Return the position of the Piece in the last row, if none return 0.

chessao.helpers.nawaleta(jack_str)¶

Map the jack choice to a Piece Class.

chessao.helpers.odejmij(hand, cards)¶

Return hand after removing the specified cards from it.

chessao.helpers.rozpakuj_input(inp)¶
>>> rozpakuj_input('24')
[2♧]
chessao.helpers.schodki_check(card_list)¶

Check if “card stairs” are build correctly.

>>> k=Card
>>> schodki_check([k(1,'6'),k(1,'7'),k(2,'7')])
True
>>> schodki_check([k(1,'2'),k(2,'3')])
False
>>> schodki_check([k(1,'7'),k(1,'6'),k(1,'5')])
True
>>> schodki_check([k(3,'6'),k(1,'6'),k(2,'6'),k(2,'6'),k(4,'6')])
True
>>> schodki_check([k(2,'2'),k(1,'2'),k(1,'3')])
False
>>> schodki_check([k(2,'3'),k(1,'3'),k(4,'3')])
True
>>> schodki_check([k(2,'6'),k(2,'7'),k(3,'7'),k(3,'6')])
True
chessao.helpers.str_to_card(str_card)¶

Return a Card obj from a string representation.

>>> str_to_card('102')
10♡
